result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Radionov was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and for Substance Abuse Program if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Bail to be applied to restitution.  Paid in full.
Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge. Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with the victim/residence.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber to commence FORTHWITH, release for work and treatment.  Sentence credit for 8 days were granted.
